titleStmt.title: Cherokee Council's decision of the conflicting claims of Mrs. E. Pack [and] Jno. [i.e., John] H. Jeffrey, 1820 Apr. 22, Council House near Hicks' Mill / [signed by] John Ross : a machine-readable transcription

availability.p: This work is the property of The Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: Cherokee Council's decision of the conflicting claims of Mrs. E. Pack [and] Jno. [i.e., John] H. Jeffrey, 1820 Apr. 22, Council House near Hicks' Mill / [signed by] John Ross
bibl.note: Copy of a legal decision of the Cherokee Council dated April 22, 1820 concerning a property dispute between Mrs. E. Pack, who purchased property from Charles Hicks, and John H. Jeffrey, who claims right due to his marriage to a Cherokee woman. The council decides in favor of Pack. Elijah Hicks created this copy.
The Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

div.p:
Cherokee Council's decision of the conflicting claims of Mrs. E. Pack
Jno. John H. Jeffrey
22nd April 1820.

address.addrLine: Council House near Elijah? Hicks mill

div.head: In Council assembled.
div.p: The national Committee and chiefs assembled for the purpose of deliberating and deciding on the following Subjects Viz.

1st. The sale of neecoojack improvement by Charles Hicks
thro. through the approbation of Sundry Chiefs to Mrs. E Pack and the forcible possession taken of said place by a certain John H. Jeffrey under pretext of having married a Cherok ee wife the daughter of
Thos. Thomas Wilson a reservee citizen of the state of Alabama named Alcey, which circumstance has produced much confusion between the said Mrs. E. Pack and
Jno. John H. Jeffrey and having a tendency of debaring debarring the said Mrs. Pack from a peaceable possession of said improvements Therefore Resolved that it is expedient that the said John H. Jeffrey be disspossed dispossessed of the said place and put into the peaceable possession of the said Mrs. E. Pack by the legal authority of the nation.
div.closer:
True Copy Elijah Hicks
Clk Clerk
By order of Committee and chiefs assembled this day year above written signed, John Ross
